paragraphs.title: Load the Reference Data To Enrich the Streaming Ratings
paragraphs.text:
val itemsDF = sqlContext.read.format("json")
  .load("file:/root/pipeline/html/advancedspark.com/json/software.json")

z.show(itemsDF.select($"id", $"title", $"img", explode($"tags")).limit(10))
itemsDF.registerTempTable("items_temp")

paragraphs.title: Read the real-time Ratings coming from Users through Kafka

result.msg:
cassandraConfig: scala.collection.immutable.Map[String,String] = Map(keyspace -> advancedspark, table -> item_ratings)
itemRatingsDF: org.apache.spark.sql.DataFrame = [userId: int, itemId: int, rating: int, timestamp: bigint]

paragraphs.title: Show the total rating count and number of Overall distinct users Who Rated (Cassandra)
paragraphs.text:
import org.apache.spark.sql.functions._

val totalRatings = itemRatingsDF.count()
val distinctUsers = itemRatingsDF.select(countDistinct($"userId")).collect()(0)(0)

result.msg:
import org.apache.spark.sql.functions._
totalRatings: Long = 0
distinctUsers: Any = 0

paragraphs.title: Show Rating Count and Number of Distinct Users Who Rated a Given Item (Redis)
paragraphs.text:
import redis.clients.jedis.Jedis

val itemId = 7 // Spark

val jedis = new Jedis("127.0.0.1", 6379)

val exactNumRatingsForItemId = jedis.get(s"""exact-rating-count:${itemId}""")
val exactNumDistinctUsersWhoRatedItemId = jedis.scard(s"""exact-distinct-user-rating-count:${itemId}""")
val approxNumDistinctUsersWhoRatedItemId = jedis.pfcount(s"""approx-distinct-user-rating-count:${itemId}""")

result.msg:
import redis.clients.jedis.Jedis
itemId: Int = 7
jedis: redis.clients.jedis.Jedis = redis.clients.jedis.Jedis@46d6f1e
exactNumRatingsForItemId: String = null
exactNumDistinctUsersWhoRatedItemId: Long = 0
approxNumDistinctUsersWhoRatedItemId: Long = 0

paragraphs.title: Use SQL to Show Most desirable users by Rating Count
paragraphs.text:
%sql SELECT title, count(itemId) as count FROM item_ratings_temp JOIN items_temp ON (item_ratings_temp.itemId = items_temp.id) 
  GROUP BY title ORDER BY count DESC LIMIT 5
%md ### Compare The Physical Plans Between DataFrames And SQL (Equal)

result.msg: Compare The Physical Plans Between DataFrames And SQL (Equal)

itemsDF: org.apache.spark.sql.DataFrame = [description: string, id: bigint, img: string, tags: array<string>, title: string]
itemRatingsDF: org.apache.spark.sql.DataFrame = [userId: int, itemId: int, rating: int, timestamp: bigint]

joinedDF: org.apache.spark.sql.DataFrame = [itemId: int, title: string, img: string, count: bigint]
== Physical Plan ==
TakeOrderedAndProject(limit=5, orderBy=[count#43L DESC], output=[itemId#40,title#34,img#32,count#43L])
 ConvertToSafe
  TungstenAggregate(key=[itemId#40,title#34,img#32], functions=[(count(itemId#40),mode=Final,isDistinct=false)], output=[itemId#40,title#34,img#32,count#43L])
   TungstenExchange hashpartitioning(itemId#40,title#34,img#32)
    TungstenAggregate(key=[itemId#40,title#34,img#32], functions=[(count(itemId#40),mode=Partial,isDistinct=false)], output=[itemId#40,title#34,img#32,currentCount#47L])
     TungstenProject [itemId#40,title#34,img#32]
      BroadcastHashJoin [cast(itemId#40 as bigint)], [id#31L], BuildRight
       ConvertToUnsafe
        Project [itemid#36 AS itemId#40]
         Scan org.apache.spark.sql.cassandra.CassandraSourceRelation@ff85b75[itemid#36]
       ConvertToUnsafe
        Scan JSONRelation[file:/root/pipeline/html/advancedspark.com/json/software.json][title#34,img#32,id#31L]

paragraphs.text:
%sql EXPLAIN SELECT itemId, title, img, count(itemId) as count FROM item_ratings_temp 
  JOIN items_temp ON (item_ratings_temp.itemId = items_temp.id) 
  GROUP BY itemId, title, img
  ORDER BY count DESC 
  LIMIT 5

result.msg:
plan
== Physical Plan ==
TakeOrderedAndProject(limit=5, orderBy=[count#49L DESC], output=[itemId#11,title#4,img#2,count#49L])
 ConvertToSafe
  TungstenAggregate(key=[itemId#11,title#4,img#2], functions=[(count(itemId#11),mode=Final,isDistinct=false)], output=[itemId#11,title#4,img#2,count#49L])
   TungstenExchange hashpartitioning(itemId#11,title#4,img#2)
    TungstenAggregate(key=[itemId#11,title#4,img#2], functions=[(count(itemId#11),mode=Partial,isDistinct=false)], output=[itemId#11,title#4,img#2,currentCount#54L])
     TungstenProject [itemId#11,title#4,img#2]
      BroadcastHashJoin [cast(itemId#11 as bigint)], [id#1L], BuildRight
       ConvertToUnsafe
        Project [itemid#7 AS itemId#11]
         Scan org.apache.spark.sql.cassandra.CassandraSourceRelation@3dd2577b[itemid#7]
       ConvertToUnsafe
        Scan JSONRelation[file:/root/pipeline/html/advancedspark.com/json/software.json][title#4,img#2,id#1L]

paragraphs.title: Save Top 5 Most Rated Items to ElasticSearch
paragraphs.text:
import org.elasticsearch.spark.sql._
import org.apache.spark.sql.SaveMode

//val mostDesirableItemsByRatingCountDF = sqlContext.sql("SELECT itemId, title, img, count(itemId) as count FROM item_ratings_temp JOIN items_temp ON (item_ratings_temp.itemId = items_temp.id) GROUP BY itemId, title, img ORDER BY count DESC LIMIT 5")

val esConfig = Map("pushdown" -> "true", "es.nodes" -> "127.0.0.1", "es.port" -> "9200")

joinedDF.write.format("org.elasticsearch.spark.sql")
  .mode(SaveMode.Overwrite)
  .options(esConfig)
  .save("advancedspark/top-items-by-exact-rating-count")

z.show(mostDesirableItemsByRatingCountDF)

result.msg:

import org.apache.spark.sql.SaveMode
